projects.title: AJHS website
projects.description: Responsible for administration, maintenance and development of the American Jewish Historical Society website from 2008 to 2015 using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Drupal.

projects.imageTitle: Finding aid for the UJA-Federation of New York collection
projects.title: United Jewish Appeal-Federation of NY Guide
projects.description: Encoded the entire finding aid to the UJA-Federation of New York collection using XML and the Encoded Archival Description (<abbr>EAD</abbr>) schema and created the folder-level database for the entire collection, linked to the finding aid. The project received the MARAC 1<sup>st</sup> Place Finding Aid Award in 2016.

projects.title: BFI IA Strategy
projects.description: IA strategy for the Buckminster Fuller Institute site redesign for the “Information Architecture and Interaction Design” course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2009.

projects.title: “Travel to Lake George” website
projects.description: Developed for final project of “Advanced Web Design” course at Pratt Institute, Summer 2009 using HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

projects.title: GadgetLibrary website
projects.description: Developed for final project of “Creating Interactive Websites with PHP” course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010 using PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS and JavaScript.

projects.title: Dalton Oral History Project website
projects.description: Developed for “Projects in Digital Archives” course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010 using the Omeka Content Management System, ImageMagick and CSS.

projects.title: Digital Stamp Collection website
projects.description: Developed for final project of “Management of Digital Content” course at Pratt Institute, Summer 2010 using Drupal 7 (archived by archive.org).

projects.title: Skyscanner (Mini-Expedia) website
projects.description: Developed as final project for ASP.NET Application Development Intensive at NYU, Spring 2011 using XML, C# ASP.NET WebForms, Microsoft SQL Server, and AJAX/jQuery.

projects.title: ContactWeb application
projects.description: Developed during the Advanced ASP.NET course Fall 2011) and ASP.NET MVC with SQL Server and Entity Framework (Spring 2012) course at NYU using C# ASP.NET MVC framework and jQuery.

projects.title: David Chu’s China Bistro website
projects.description: Developed for the Coursera “HTML, CSS and JavaScript” course, Summer 2016. The site utilizes JSON and AJAX to dynamically display content.

projects.title: Ristorante con Fusion website
projects.description: Developed for the Coursera “Front-End JavaScript Frameworks: AngularJS” course, Summer 2016 using the MEAN stack with AngularJS, NodeJS and Bootstrap.

projects.title: Ristorante con Fusion mobile app
projects.description: Developed for the Coursera “Multiplatform Mobile Application Development with Web Technologies” course, Summer 2016 using AngularJS, NodeJS, MongoDB/Mongoose, the Ionic Framework and Apache Cordova.

projects.title: AlbumFinder
projects.description: Worked on a side-project AlbumFinder that explored the Apple iTunes API, along with using AngularJS, Angular UI Grid, jQuery and Bootstrap, January 2018. The grid provides the capability to save album data to a .csv, .pdf, or .xls file.

projects.title: Tour of Stylish Heroes
projects.description: Developed “Tour of Stylish Heroes” using Angular 4 and Angular Material 2 at Angular Summit in Boston, September 2017. Features a dashboard with search capability and heroes view with ability to create/delete heroes.

projects.title: People Project
projects.description: Developed “People Project” using Angular 4, TypeScript and ES6 at Angular Summit in Boston, September 2017. The project reads the metadata from a .csv file on the server, displays it on the front-end in a sortable table and uses custom Angular pipes.

projects.title: NYC Archivisualizer
projects.description: Design project proposal created for “Projects in Digital Archives” course at Pratt Institute, Spring 2010.

projects.imageTitle: Usability Study of the MEA & IGS
projects.title: Usability Study of the MEA & IGS
projects.description: Usability Study of the Media Ecology Association and the Institute of General Semantics created for “Usability Leadership” course at Pratt Institute, Fall 2009.

projects.title: Basketball Facts ASP.NET Wizard project
projects.description: Developed a wizard using ASP.NET WebForms wizard controls created for “ASP.NET Application Development Intensive” at NYU, March 2011. If not a member, the user has to sign up and then login to use the application. Once logged in, the user is able to start the wizard. Feedback is given during the quiz and a final score is calculated at the end.

projects.title: American Jewish Congress finding aid
projects.description: Processed and encoded the finding aid to the American Jewish Congress collection at the AJHS in October 2011.

projects.imageTitle: American Association for Ethiopian Jews (AAEJ) finding aid
projects.title: American Association for Ethiopian Jews (AAEJ) finding aid
projects.description: Processed and encoded the finding aid to the Records of the American Association for Ethiopian Jews (AAEJ) at the AJHS in January 2012.

projects.imageTitle: National Conference on Soviet Jewry (NCSJ) finding aid
projects.title: National Conference on Soviet Jewry (NCSJ) finding aid
projects.description: Encoded the finding aid to the National Conference on Soviet Jewry (NCSJ) collection at the AJHS in March 2015.

projects.imageTitle: National Jewish Welfare Board (NJWB) finding aid
projects.title: National Jewish Welfare Board (NJWB) finding aid
projects.description: Created folder-level database and encoded the finding aid to the National Jewish Welfare Board (NJWB) records at the AJHS in May 2007.

projects.title: Cecilia Razovsky finding aid
projects.description: Processed collection and encoded the finding aid to the Papers of Cecilia Razovsky at the AJHS in March 2006. This was one of the first finding aids I worked on at AJHS.

projects.title: UJA-Fed of NY WordPress blog
projects.description: Collaborated on a 4-year project, wrote blog entries in WordPress from 2012 to 2015 and customized the WordPress site for the UJA-Federation of NY collection project.

projects.title: “The Federation City” Interactive Map
projects.description: Worked on the database portion for the interactive map for the UJA-Federation of NY project.

projects.title: UJA timeline
projects.description: Added metadata to the timeline through the Drupal CMS front-end.

projects.title: ng-recipe-book
projects.description: Developed a fully-functional Recipe Book application with Recipes and Shopping List modules using Angular 5 as final project for the “Angular 5 - The Complete Guide” course on Udemy. User authentication with Firebase on the backend. App uses the NgRx library and is hosted on AWS S3.

projects.title: NYC Subway System
projects.description: Programmed a simulation of the NYC Subway System using C++ and the Bellman-Ford algorithm to compute shortest path(s) between any two stations. The project received the Best Individual Project Award in the Advanced Algorithms in C++ class at Polytechnic University, Fall 2000.

projects.title: Mandelbrot Set
projects.description: Programmed various applets of the Mandelbrot Set using Java as part of the graduate Java course at Polytechnic University, Spring 2001.

projects.title: PNotes
projects.description: Programmed a system to store and retrieve project notes using Java, RMI, and Oracle DB. The project was started during the graduate Object-Oriented Analysis and Design using Java course in Fall of 2001 and became the project worked on during Software Engineering and Advanced Senior Project in Computer Science courses. The project was completed in Fall of 2002.

projects.title: Auction System
projects.description: Worked on a team project to implement a real-time online auction system using Java and applied application security concepts to secure the application. The team also participated in security and vulnerability testing of other student group applications.

projects.title: Portable GPS Data Logger
projects.description: Programmed an Arduino to log GPS coordinate data to an SD card, output the data to a LCD and create map of route traveled for the final project for the Programming for Interactivity course at Pratt Institute, Fall 2009.

projects.title: Angular Messenger application
projects.description: Developed a Messenger application that provides the ability to edit and delete messages with Message, Authentication and Error handling modules using the MEAN stack as final project for the “Angular (Angular 2+) & NodeJS - The MEAN Stack Guide” course on Udemy. The app is hosted on Heroku.

projects.title: JavaScript Accu-Weather App
projects.description: Developed an accu-weather application using HTML, CSS and mainly JavaScript as final project of the “Accelerated JavaScript Training” bootcamp course on Udemy, which displays real-time weather condition and temperature in Fahrenheit for searched city name. I also added coordinates of city name, humidity, windspeed and photo of current condition. App showcases important JavaScript concepts (DOM selectors and manipulation, AJAX XHR with OpenWeatherMap API, working with JSON, and object-oriented programming in JS) learned throughout the course, completed April 2018.
